Eötvös József Foundation School provides post-secondary vocational education and training in the fields of tourism and finance. Due to the characteristics of the training the school considers that building international relations is a strategic factor. The 3-month-long work placements provide a great opportunity to establish international relations.
The students of this school have the chance to spend their work placement in the United Kingdom, Switzerland and Germany. 112 students attend this institution, and 97 students study Tourism. 70% of those who study Tourism spend their professional practice abroad. 
We are the advocates of internationalism which means that the demands towards the school board and the teachers are higher than the average.
Due to various reasons most of our students come from a poor financial background since most part of Békés county is considered a less favoured area. Providing opportunity for the students with a poor financial background is the central idea of the institution. Work placements abroad unquestionably constitute an opportunity for those students who after graduating secondary school did not pursue higher education for different reasons.
English2000 School of English in Bournemouth has been the partner institution of the school in eight Leonardo projects and one Erasmus project so far.  An excellent relationship developed between the two partner institutions not only at a professional, but also at a human level.
The project has two phases. One-week language and work preparation course conducted at English2000. This course is followed by a 12-week professional practice at the hotels near Bournemouth. Taking into consideration mutual principles, the language school chooses the hotels and also monitors the students’ work. Keeping contact with English2000, as well as with the appointed hotels and the students during the whole work placement period is crucial.
The main purpose of the project is to gain work experience, broaden the students’ professional knowledge in tourism and catering, to fulfil the professional practice required by the syllabus, and to improve language skills. Other objectives are: getting to know other cultures, getting references for the future, and last but not least, cultivating the relationship between the partner institutions.
The main phases of the realization of the project: 1. Announcing and presenting the professional practice abroad to the students. 2. Recruiting the students. 3. Preparing the recruited students, providing additional training and help. The students attend language, professional and cultural courses at the school. 4. Organising the placement at different hotels with the help of the partner institution (appointing the hotels where the professional practice will take place, making all the travel and accommodation arrangements, taking out insurance, assigning the accompanying teacher). 5. A one-week language and work preparation course in England at English2000.  6. A 12-week work experience at hotels mentored and tutored by English2000. 7. Keeping contact with the partner, the appointed hotels and the students during the whole work placement period. 8. Assessing, discussing and disseminating the results of the project. 9. Closing the project, writing a financial and professional report. 
Besides the development of professional skills and knowledge, by the end of the project the students will be able to work in a team, their work morale will be improved, and an aspiration for accurate work will be formed. Not only will they be more fluent in English, but they will also learn to respect the culture of other nations getting an insight into European culture. Undeniably, they are going to become more open and independent as well.
Eötvös József Foundation School can make use of the experiences of the project in its teaching and educational work. Successful projects improve the image and the social capital of the school, the opportunity of spending the professional practice abroad appeals to future students at schooling. All in all, the project increases the competitiveness of the school. The students who graduate Eötvös József Foundation School and become part of the labour market are highly qualified young adults capable of creating a bigger value.

In the framework of this project the institution intends to send 20 students in two groups abroad. 
1st group: 17 October 2015 – 16 January 2016
2nd group: 9 April 2016 – 25 June 2016
The students are accompanied by an escorting teacher who spends a week in the United Kingdom. During the first week the escorting teacher’s responsibility is to help the students with any problem that may arise, to build relationships with the appointed work placements, as well as to attend classes at English2000.

Mobil in Europa mit berufsorientierten Fachpraktika

Be mobile in Europe with vocational internships

Kulturwerke Deutschland Sprachreisen GmbH is a German provider of internships abroad for apprentices in numerous different industries. Since 2014 we help young adults organise their stay abroad (mostly in the United Kingdom) and therefore act as an intermediary and as a contact person for young adults, mostly from Germany. In this project we will offer pool  projects for all 34 individual learners from Germany.

In collaboration with our partner English 2000, our goal is to promote and strengthen intercultural exchange, foreign experience as well as subject-specific knowledge for our participants. We want to provide future employees with work experience abroad and help enhance important skills like flexibility, openness as well as language skills.

Our main function is to help prospective customers find a suitable internship, review their applications and collect all the necessary data and documents for their stay. We also assist our participants in finding flights and take out travel insurance. Our participants have the opportunity to request a position in a specific field of work. 

They attend an English course before starting their internship. Before departing, we provide the participant with all the necessary information concerning their internship and accommodation, a packing list as well as instructions on how to reach the accommodation.
 
During their stay we regularly ask the participants to fill in evaluation reports on how their internship is going and send them back to us to analyse them. This way we make sure our participants are having the internship and experience they wished for. This procedure enables us to further improve our programme. 

Our partner English 2000 acts as the local programme coordinator for the participants and as their main contact person during their time abroad. The participants have the opportunity to talk to trained staff whenever they have questions.

After many years of collaborating with English 2000 all our processes are well coordinated, so that we can guarantee a successful project for every participant. 

Kulturwerke Deutschland Sprachreisen‘s goal is to contribute to the internationalisation of businesses and to strengthen the European integration as well as international relations especially between Germany, the United Kingdom and other European countries.

Széchenyi István Bilingual Secondary Technical School of Economics and English 2000 School of English are planning to organise work experience for 10 students in the hotel and catering industry in the United Kingdom. Széchenyi István Bilingual Secondary Technical School provided education in the field of tourism and economics from year 9 to 12. In 2016 the school took over the tourism courses and the students of Eötvös József Foundation School, thus two additional years were added to the existing ones: year 13 and 14.
Due to the characteristics of the training the school considers building international relations a strategic factor and lays great emphasis on cultivating the relationship with foreign partners. The main form of international relations is 3-month-long work placements abroad.
The students of the school have the opportunity to spend their work placement in the United Kingdom, Switzerland and Germany. 
796 students study at Széchenyi István Bilingual Secondary Technical School, 80 students study tourism on the 13th and 14th year. A lot of our students come from a poor financial background since most parts of Békés County are considered disadvantaged areas. Students on the 13th and 14th year did not continue their studies in higher education so vocational training provides them opportunity to improve and work experiences abroad unquestionably mean new opportunities to them. The aim of the school is to make work placements possible for an increasing number of students.
The main aims of the project are to gain work experience, to broaden the students’ professional knowledge in tourism and catering, to fulfil the work experience required by the curriculum, and to improve language skills. Other objectives are: getting to know other cultures, getting references for the future and cultivating the relationship between the partner institutions. Work experiences abroad are huge motivating factors for students.
The partner of the school in the project is English 2000 School of English in Bournemouth. The partner has organised several successful projects in the field of hotel and catering for students of tourism within the framework of Leonardo and Erasmus projects. An excellent relationship has developed between the members of the project team and the partner institution not only at a professional, but also at a personal level.
The project has two phases: a one-week language and work preparation course conducted at English 2000 followed by a 12-week work placement at hotels in or near Bournemouth. The partner hotels are chosen by English 2000 on the basis of pre-agreed principles. Monitoring and mentoring are also provided by our partner institution. Keeping contact with English 2000, as well as with the appointed hotels and the students during the whole work placement period is crucial.
 The main phases of the realization of the project: 1. Announcing and presenting the professional practice abroad to the students. 2. Recruiting the students. 3. Preparing the recruited students, providing additional training and help. The students attend language, professional and cultural courses at the school. 4. Organising the placement at different hotels with the help of the partner institution (appointing the hotels where the professional practice will take place, making all the travel and accommodation arrangements, taking out insurance, assigning the accompanying teacher). 5. A one-week language and work preparation course in England at English 2000. 6. A 12-week work experience in hotels mentored and tutored by English 2000. 7. Keeping contact with the partner, the appointed hotels and the students during the whole work placement period. 8.Continuous assessment and disseminating the results of the project. 9. Closing the project, writing the financial and the final report.
Besides the development of professional skills and knowledge, by the end of the project the students will be able to work in a team, their work morale will improve, and an aspiration for accurate work will be formed. Not only will they be more fluent in English, but they will also learn to respect the culture of other nations getting an insight into European culture. Undeniably, they are going to become more open-minded and independent as well.
The long-term results of the project will be that Széchenyi István Bilingual Secondary Technical School can make use of the experiences of the project in its teaching and educational work. Successful projects improve the image and the social capital of the school, the opportunity of spending the professional practice abroad appeals to future students at schooling. The project increases the competitiveness of the school.
We are planning the work experience of 10 students in two groups.
1st group: from 21 October 2017 to 20 January 2018.
2nd group: from 2 June 2018 to 1 September 2018.
Formation professionnelle : partir pour mieux revenir

This project involves 20 students preparing a Baccalauréat Professionnel in Administrative Management (2nd year of a two-year course) by attending a European class and 6 students preparing a Baccalauréat Professionnel in Social Work. The stay will take place in Bournemouth or Seville for four weeks in May 2015. Our goal is to develop and improve students' knowledge and skills through international European travel that will afford greater cultural, linguistic and professional expertise. This will certainly improve their employment prospects in Aquitaine.

During the months preceding their placement, from September 2014 to April 2015, our students will undertake a cultural, linguistic and professional training  in order to make the most of the experience .
This placement will add value to their training, they will be able to develop communication skills,  analyze different approaches used  within  the working world in European countries, and adapt to a new culture and  daily  life of the country they live in.

Our partners in England and Spain will provide accommodation for students, as well as organising educational activities, in close cooperation with teachers from our school who will supervise them throughout their stay as they are minors. 

We will be in regular contact with these partners (by mail , phone and during a preparatory visit), we will sign an Erasmus+ contract in which the rights and obligations of each party will be clearly described.This project will enable us to develop the European dimension of our school, thus  promoting the training given  to all our students.
The dissemination of the project and of the work carried out by the students and the team of teachers will strengthen the links between our school and our partners (companies and institutional partners).

Aufbau des Auslandspraktikums an der HAK/HAS Lustenau

Last year the HAK/HAS (business college) Lustenau provided its students with the opportunity of attending an internship abroad for the first time. Unfortunately, only two students grabbed this chance. This project now aims at increasing the number of participants. After intense evaluation of the first project, another project in the form of an internship could be developed, which is more suited to the students of our school. Consequently, there are now 32 participants. In order to reach this goal, the following activities have been conducted:

• interviews with students in order to evaluate the previous project
• development of an internship appropriate for the students 
• intensive information of the students as well as the parents 
• integration of the project into the course design of the school in order to increase its significance

The acceptance and extensive integration of the internship abroad is especially important since the requirements for students of the business college Lustenau have changed radically due to changes in the working world, especially in Vorarlberg. While until a few years ago, it was small to medium-sized enterprises that were active mainly at regional level, it is now high-tech companies that act on a global basis. This increased internationality is also illustrated by Vorarlberg’s export quotas and can be seen in the job descriptions and vacancies: Working in international teams, multilingualism and international work experience are increasingly sought-after and ever more important job qualifications. Therefore, the internship is supposed to support the students in:

• quickly finding a job and being integrated into the business world after graduating
• learning important administration skills 
• improving and reinforcing their language skills 
• feeling what it means to be foreign and dealing with cultural differences, which is an important experience in order to become open-minded towards other cultures and to contribute to a good integration at their school 
• experiencing the core values of the EU (free movement of persons, free choice of work)

In this respect, the development of a small but high-quality network of partner organisations plays a significant role and will be conducted in several steps. While this project (2016/2017) focussed on English-speaking partners, the next project (2017/2018) is supposed to be expanded on French- and Spanish-speaking partners as well. On a long-term basis, the business college Lustenau should be perceived as an international school in Vorarlberg.

The internship abroad is especially important since the require-ments for students of the business college Lustenau have changed radically due to changes in the working world, especially in Vorarlberg. While until a few years ago, it was small to medium-sized enterprises that were active mainly at regional level, it is now high-tech companies acting on a global basis that predomi-nate. This increased internationality can be seen in the job de-scriptions and vacancies: Working in international teams, multi-lingualism and international work experience are increasingly sought-after and ever more important job qualifications. Moreover the entry into professional life is getting harder for young people. If they can provide professional experience, the chances of get-ting a job are better. Additionally, the requirements at school are growing. In the international branch, where most students come from, three languages are taught. Thanks to the internship the participants could improve their English marks greatly, i.e. this project is essential in helping students on their way to a success-ful graduation. Therefore, especially under-performing students were addressed when the project was presented.
As the school has a high number of students with migration back-ground, this project makes an important contribution towards in-tegration because for the first time students experience what it means to be a 'foreigner'. That is why the project should have the following benefit. The internship is supposed to support the stu-dents in:

• quickly finding a job and being integrated into the business world after graduating
• learning important administration skills 
• improving language marks of low performance students or rein-forcing the knowledge of good students
• feeling what it means to be foreign and dealing with cultural differences, which is an important experience in order to become open-minded towards other cultures and to contribute to a good integration at their school 
• experiencing the core values of the EU (free movement of per-sons, free choice of work) 

Last year the HAK/HAS (business college) Lustenau provided 29 students with the opportunity of attending an internship abroad - the year before there were only two students. (Unfortunately, on-ly two students grabbed this chance.?) Due to the project-evaluation of the last year we decided not to extend to Spain/France but to improve our current English partner-network. We organized a new group-offer for financially disadvantaged families and we tried to find a new partner in Malta (at the stu-dents’ request). Furthermore we would like to offer an traineeship for a disabled student. The project contains the following central steps:

Consequently, there are now 32 participants. In order to reach this goal, the following activities have been conducted:

1. Interviews with students and partners in order to evaluate the previous project
2. Revision of the organisation and implementation of the intern-ship-project
3. Extension of the group offer and first-time internship-placement for disabeld students
4. Systematic information and preparation of the students and parents
5. Integration of the project into the course design and pedagogic concept of the school in order to increase its significance
6. Improvement of the partner-contact through personal meetings and on-site support. 
7. Improvement of the involvement of English teachers
8. Spreading information on the project to at least three feeder schools (BACK to SCHOOL)
9. Detailed documentation and evaluation of the project man-agement

The following effects are intended:
• increasing the employability of students
• increasing the entrepreneurship-competence through enforce-ment of the students’ independence and self-organisation
• increasing integration ability
• advancement of the project/internship-quality
• increasing the school’s public notice as an international school.

The following application describes our project of students in vocational training of the Berufsbildende Schulen 1 in Aurich, Germany.

20 of our students will have the possibility of completing three weeks of practical training in companies of the English town of Bournemouth.

During their time of practical training they have got the chance of educating themselves in the fields of their own personality, the spoken and written English language, besides getting to know a foreign culture, another way of life and more intercultural aspects.

The participants are students of our special offer of an additional training known as "Kauffrau/Kaufmann für internationale Geschäftstätigkeit" - a course especially concerned with international matters such as international marketing, import and exports of goods and overseas business and foreign operations. All these students are participating in this course during their free time in addition to their daily apprenticeships in regional businesses.
In addition all the participants study English as well as another (second) foreign language, Spanish. At the end of their course they achieve the certificates of the German Chamber of Industry and Commerce.
In order to successfully complete the whole course, all participants have to do a three-week praktical training abroad.

The companies of our region "Ostfriesland" are already involved internationally or are aspiring to do so. This means that the qualifications of out students in international matters are highly welcome. Our students have got good chances on the employment market of this economically rather weak region.

With this project we prepare out students and give them the opportunity of learning how to cope with situations an dhow to get along in a foreign country and in another language. We want them to have courage and to be open for everything new and unknown.

The practical training in Bournemouth will be in the field and functional direction of their respective apprenticeships in Germany. The companies will be chonsen for them according to these needs and to fit their area of operation which are mainly administrative. Students might have their own small projects in the companies, they will take part in client counseling or take care of client or supplyer data.
This way our students have got the opportunity to broaden their minds concerning their personality, but also their language knowledge and most importantly getting along in another unknown company and learning about their way of businesss. 

The three weeks of practical training abroad are supported by the home companies, students even get additional free days and financial support.

Our partner, English 2000 - School of English in Bournemouth, will supervise our students, they will organize accomodation in host families, find suitable companies for the practical training and have a language course ready organized.
Devenir citoyen européen par l'expérience professionnelle

After the creation of European sections for students in BACCALAUREAT PROFESSIONNEL ARCU and GA (BTEC NAT in reception and customer relationship and BTEC NAT in Management and Administration) within our vocational high school, we decided to set up a European project so that they could have their training period abroad during their 3rd year. This period will take place  for four weeks in Bournemouth, a small British sea resort. 
It will be a privileged moment to make sense of the subjects taught at school and bring essential elements: a job in another country, days spent in an unknown cultural and professional environment and a direct contact with a foreign language.
Moreover this project lies on our school open-mindedness which leads to the writing of a European dimension in our school project, raising awareness of the European identity (visit to the House of Europe, trips, British day, theater play in English, organisation of a European week), the vitality of English classes (using the digital board, the video-projector, films screened in original, the language classrooms), the presence of an English assistant and the reception of European teachers within professional trainings.
This training period will enable the students to get language skills as well as know-how and professional social skills and cultural social skills in relation to the chosen language. This project will play a part in their self-enrichment by stimulating the participants’ cultural and human horizons. This idea comes from a will to provide the participants language skills to facilitate their integration into employment for which using a foreign language is an asset. This corresponds to our vocational high school mission: facilitate our students’ integration in the working world.
To carry out the project we have worked on that file within the working group which had been set up for the creation of the European section : the headmaster, the professional teaching manager, the account manager, the English teachers and the sales, management and administration teachers (DNL:selling,administration and management classes in English).

The requirements for students of the business college Lustenau have changed radically due to changes in the working world, especially in Vorarlberg. While until a few years ago it was small to medium-sized enterprises that were active mainly at regional level, it is now high tech companies that act on a global basis. This increased internationality is also illustrated by Vorarlberg’s export quotas and can be seen in the job descriptions and vacancies: Working in international teams, multilingualism and international work experience are increasingly sought-after and ever more important job qualifications. In order to prepare students in the best possible way for increasingly networked working environments, the business college Lustenau introduced an international branch of study three years ago and this year the project ‘Business college Lustenau goes International’, where the foreign internalship is an essential aspect.The foreign internalship is immensely important for the students, as it supports them in......fulfilling the high demands with regard to multilingualism within this educational programme,...learning what it means to work abroad,...developing the skill of working with people from different national and cultural backgrounds,...experiencing the core values of the EU (free movements of persons, free choice of work),...collecting hands-on work experience already during education, and thus boosting the chances of finding a job easily after graduating.... preparing them for work with international enterprisesThe internship abroad constitutes a central part in combining theoretical as well as practical aspects within the educational programme. “Internationality” can be taught only up to a certain extent – true internationality can only be conveyed through hands-on experience. In order for this project to be successful, a number of systematic measures, recorded in a project manual, have been and are being executed. The first of these measures is an intensive-information week for EVERY class. Preparation and implementation are integrated into a school subject (Business Behaviour), every student gets his/her own supervising teacher and a progress record is kept in the form of an internship-portfolio. In the long run both students and enterprises should regard the business college Lustenau as an international educational institution. This should assure that graduates get a job quickly and more importantly, they should  be well prepared for the work with international teams and enterprises.
Improving collaborative working between correctional and mental health services

Effective collaboration between mental health (MHS) and correctional services (CS) impacts on mental illness and reduces reoffending rates. Service leaders have indicated a need for more effective models of collaboration. Researchers have identified the Change Laboratory Model (CLM) of workplace transformation as a more effective means of supporting interagency collaborative practice than current integration tools. It provides a way to optimise the effectiveness of mental healthcare provision to offenders through a model that fosters innovation and collaborative processes. However, the change laboratory, highly successful internationally and in other clinical contexts, is a new idea in prison development, none as yet being applied to the challenges facing the MHS and CS. The wickedness, complexity and unpredictability of challenges facing interagency working in these secure environments means that piloting the CLM is premature and it must first be adapted to the MHS/CS context. The aim of this study is to validate the change laboratory model ready for implementation in practice. This RISE application builds a community of practice that enriches international research capacity and cooperation to achieve this aim. It brings academic knowledge of the Change Laboratory model to the market of interagency practices between mental health and correctional services for the development of innovation and the advancement of integrated service provision to mentally ill offenders. Knowledge exchange takes place through secondments, interactive workshops, the development of workforce training programmes, study tours, shadowing opportunities and ethnographic research.  Through this knowledge exchange, the consortium delivers a user-informed prototype of change laboratory model ready for implementation in the MHS and CS field. This validated change laboratory model, offers the ERA a clear strategy with which to promote integrated care for mentally ill offenders.
